alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:34PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan and southeastern Bell Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Binghamtown, or over Middlesboro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ponza around 245 PM EDT. Hutch, Calvin and Varilla around 250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cubage and Oaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
